name: places/ChIJxwxR9o3zwokRpSeNmXVk3vg
adrFormatAddress: 40 W 225th St, Bronx, NY 10463, USA

editorialSummary.text: Drugstore chain selling a variety of beauty & health products, plus some grocery & household items.

originalText.text: I went to this pharmacy for the first time after my local  CVS was temporarily closed due to a fire. Very friendly and fast service.

text.text: I went to this pharmacy for the first time after my local  CVS was temporarily closed due to a fire. Very friendly and fast service.

originalText.text: CVS on 40 w225 Bronx is horrible with keeping pain medication in stock. Being disable wheelchair bound. I deal with severe pain. Which make it hard to stand nd sleep. I’ve waited days at one time, which turned into weeks, turned into 1 month nd this time was about a week 1/2 shy of 2 months.  Had I not called to check if the pain meds were in stock. I’ve would’ve still be waiting. They don’t bother to look at any prescription that’s been on hold when the meds do come in, to be filled. I’ve experienced this multiple x’s. Having to call and see if it been filled. I would call and she would say “ok come in a hour”. Like umm the prescription has been there for hours, another time a month. So had I not called I would’ve still be waiting. Oh yea I’ll get the test stating my prescription will be ready , after that called to check if it’s been filled. Because it’s close to my place this is what I have to put up with. Because a lot of local mom and pops don’t hold my pain meds I have to deal with a corporation. I don’t have time to look for small businesses pharma. Cause so many ppl has messed it up for ppl like me who really need pain meds. It’s Hydrocodone. Btw nd when I ask for oxycodone they didn’t have that either. So this is why they get 1 star.also the lack of concern the techs or whoever is responsible to check the prescriptions, making sure they get filled upon arrival of back order medication

originalText.text: I travel out of my way to go to CVS at Target on 225th.  It's important for me to be treated kindly and respectfully and this staff meets all standards in my eyes.  Highly recommended!!!!

text.text: I travel out of my way to go to CVS at Target on 225th.  It's important for me to be treated kindly and respectfully and this staff meets all standards in my eyes.  Highly recommended!!!!

originalText.text: The staff are always great when checking me out. I've had good experiences picking up my medication here for the past 1 1/2 years.

text.text: The staff are always great when checking me out. I've had good experiences picking up my medication here for the past 1 1/2 years.

originalText.text: This CVS is by far one of the worst in terms of customer communication.  I've tried to call this location twice to determine if they had a medication in stock since my Rx is out virtually everywhere.  Both times I called, the wait time was 90 minutes minimum.  Both times, I just hung up in frustration.  This pharmacy serves a poor & working class community.  People here deserve quality care and respect.  It's outlandish that they can just ignore calls.  I didn't experience this kind of wait when I lived in the suburbs. If my doctor needed to reach them, the wait would be absolutely unacceptable. I will be contacting headquarters. These folks are in a customer facing job.  If this isn't something you can do effectively or efficiently, then quit!  Can't speak for the in person service but knowing this store, I suspect it's not great.   Do BETTER!
